title: Unveiling the Impact of Data and Model Scaling on High-Level Control for Humanoid Robots
summary: Data scaling has long remained a critical bottleneck in robot learning. For humanoid robots, human videos and motion data are abundant and widely available, offering a free and large-scale data source. Besides, the semantics related to the motions enable modality alignment and high-level robot control learning. However, how to effectively mine raw video, extract robot-learnable representations, and leverage them for scalable learning remains an open problem. To address this, we introduce Humanoid-Union, a large-scale dataset generated through an autonomous pipeline, comprising over 260 hours of diverse, high-quality humanoid robot motion data with semantic annotations derived from human motion videos. The dataset can be further expanded via the same pipeline. Building on this data resource, we propose SCHUR, a scalable learning framework designed to explore the impact of large-scale data on high-level control in humanoid robots. Experimental results demonstrate that SCHUR achieves high robot motion generation quality and strong text-motion alignment under data and model scaling, with 37\% reconstruction improvement under MPJPE and 25\% alignment improvement under FID comparing with previous methods. Its effectiveness is further validated through deployment in real-world humanoid robot.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了Humanoid-Union，一个通过自动化流程从人类视频生成的大规模人形机器人运动数据集（超过260小时），并提出了SCHUR，一个可扩展的学习框架，用于利用该数据集实现人形机器人高质量运动生成和文本-运动对齐，并在真实机器人上进行了验证。
AI.motivation: 机器人学习中的数据扩展一直是关键瓶颈。尽管人类视频和运动数据丰富，可作为人形机器人的免费大规模数据源，但如何有效挖掘原始视频、提取机器人可学习的表示并将其用于可扩展学习仍是一个开放问题。
AI.method: 本文通过一个自主管道生成了Humanoid-Union数据集，该数据集包含超过260小时的多样化、高质量人形机器人运动数据，并附带从人类运动视频中提取的语义注释。在此数据资源的基础上，提出了SCHUR，一个可扩展的学习框架，旨在探索大规模数据对人形机器人高级控制的影响。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，SCHUR在数据和模型扩展下实现了高机器人运动生成质量和强大的文本-运动对齐。与现有方法相比，MPJPE重建性能提升37%，FID对齐性能提升25%。其有效性通过在真实世界人形机器人上的部署得到了进一步验证。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的Humanoid-Union数据集和SCHUR学习框架有效地解决了人形机器人学习中的数据扩展瓶颈，通过利用大规模人类运动数据，显著提升了机器人运动生成质量和文本-运动对齐能力，并展示了在真实机器人上的实用性。

title: Classifying Histopathologic Glioblastoma Sub-regions with EfficientNet
summary: Glioblastoma (GBM) is the most common aggressive, fast-growing brain tumor, with a grim prognosis. Despite clinical diagnostic advancements, there have not been any substantial improvements to patient prognosis. Histopathological assessment of excised tumors is the first line of clinical diagnostic routine. We hypothesize that automated, robust, and accurate identification of distinct histological sub-regions within GBM could contribute to morphologically understanding this disease at scale. In this study, we designed a four-step deep learning approach to classify six (6) histopathological regions and quantitatively evaluated it on the BraTS-Path 2024 challenge dataset, which includes digitized Hematoxylin \& Eosin (H\&E) stained GBM tissue sections annotated for six distinct regions. We used the challenge's publicly available training dataset to develop and evaluate the effectiveness of several variants of EfficientNet architectures (i.e., B0, B1, B2, B3, B4). EfficientNet-B1 and EfficientNet-B4 achieved the best performance, achieving an F1 score of 0.98 in a 5-fold cross-validation configuration using the BraTS-Path training set. The quantitative performance evaluation of our proposed approach with EfficientNet-B1 on the BraTS-Path hold-out validation data and the final hidden testing data yielded F1 scores of 0.546 and 0.517, respectively, for the associated 6-class classification task. The difference in the performance on training, validation, and testing data highlights the challenge of developing models that generalize well to new data, which is crucial for clinical applications. The source code of the proposed approach can be found at the GitHub repository of Indiana University Division of Computational Pathology: https://github.com/IUCompPath/brats-path-2024-enet.

AI.tldr: 本研究开发了一种四步深度学习方法，利用EfficientNet架构对胶质母细胞瘤（GBM）的六种组织病理学区域进行分类，并在BraTS-Path 2024挑战赛数据集上进行了评估。
AI.motivation: 胶质母细胞瘤（GBM）是一种预后极差的侵袭性脑肿瘤。尽管诊断技术有所进步，但患者预后并未显著改善。研究者假设，对GBM内不同组织学亚区域进行自动化、鲁棒和准确的识别，有助于大规模地形态学理解该疾病。
AI.method: 研究设计了一种四步深度学习方法，用于分类六种组织病理学区域。该方法在BraTS-Path 2024挑战赛数据集上进行了定量评估，该数据集包含六个不同区域的H&E染色GBM组织切片。研究使用了多种EfficientNet架构变体（B0、B1、B2、B3、B4），并在挑战赛的公开训练数据集上进行开发和评估，采用5折交叉验证配置。
AI.result: 在BraTS-Path训练集上，EfficientNet-B1和EfficientNet-B4在5折交叉验证中取得了最佳性能，F1分数达到0.98。然而，在BraTS-Path保留验证数据和最终隐藏测试数据上，使用EfficientNet-B1的方法在6类分类任务中分别获得了0.546和0.517的F1分数。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明深度学习方法可以用于胶质母细胞瘤组织病理学区域的分类，但在训练、验证和测试数据上的性能差异突出了模型泛化到新数据的挑战，这对于临床应用至关重要。

title: LLM-Guided Probabilistic Fusion for Label-Efficient Document Layout Analysis
summary: Document layout understanding remains data-intensive despite advances in semi-supervised learning. We present a framework that enhances semi-supervised detection by fusing visual predictions with structural priors from text-pretrained LLMs via principled probabilistic weighting. Given unlabeled documents, an OCR-LLM pipeline infers hierarchical regions which are combined with teacher detector outputs through inverse-variance fusion to generate refined pseudo-labels.Our method demonstrates consistent gains across model scales. With a lightweight SwiftFormer backbone (26M params), we achieve 88.2$\pm$0.3 AP using only 5\% labels on PubLayNet. When applied to document-pretrained LayoutLMv3 (133M params), our fusion framework reaches 89.7$\pm$0.4 AP, surpassing both LayoutLMv3 with standard semi-supervised learning (89.1$\pm$0.4 AP, p=0.02) and matching UDOP~\cite{udop} (89.8 AP) which requires 100M+ pages of multimodal pretraining. This demonstrates that LLM structural priors are complementary to both lightweight and pretrained architectures. Key findings include: (1) learned instance-adaptive gating improves over fixed weights by +0.9 AP with data-dependent PAC bounds correctly predicting convergence; (2) open-source LLMs enable privacy-preserving deployment with minimal loss (Llama-3-70B: 87.1 AP lightweight, 89.4 AP with LayoutLMv3); (3) LLMs provide targeted semantic disambiguation (18.7\% of cases, +3.8 AP gain) beyond simple text heuristics.Total system cost includes \$12 for GPT-4o-mini API or 17 GPU-hours for local Llama-3-70B per 50K pages, amortized across training runs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出一个框架，通过将视觉预测与大型语言模型（LLM）的结构先验知识进行概率加权融合，增强了半监督文档布局检测，显著提升了性能并降低了数据依赖。
AI.motivation: 尽管半监督学习有所进展，但文档布局理解仍然是数据密集型任务。
AI.method: 该方法通过OCR-LLM管道推断分层区域，并将其与教师检测器输出通过逆方差融合（inverse-variance fusion）相结合，生成精细的伪标签。此外，还采用了实例自适应门控（instance-adaptive gating）来改进权重分配。
AI.result: 该方法在不同模型规模上均表现出持续的性能提升。使用SwiftFormer骨干网络（26M参数），在PubLayNet上仅用5%标签即达到88.2 AP。应用于LayoutLMv3（133M参数）时，达到89.7 AP，超过了标准半监督学习的LayoutLMv3（89.1 AP），并与需要大量多模态预训练的UDOP（89.8 AP）持平。主要发现包括：(1) 实例自适应门控比固定权重提升0.9 AP；(2) 开源LLM（如Llama-3-70B）可实现隐私保护部署，性能损失极小；(3) LLM能提供有针对性的语义消歧（18.7%的案例，提升3.8 AP）。系统总成本较低。
AI.conclusion: LLM的结构先验知识与轻量级和预训练架构都具有互补性，能有效增强半监督文档布局理解。该框架通过智能融合LLM结构信息，显著提升了模型性能、效率和语义理解能力，并支持隐私保护部署。

title: HyperD: Hybrid Periodicity Decoupling Framework for Traffic Forecasting
summary: Accurate traffic forecasting plays a vital role in intelligent transportation systems, enabling applications such as congestion control, route planning, and urban mobility optimization.However, traffic forecasting remains challenging due to two key factors: (1) complex spatial dependencies arising from dynamic interactions between road segments and traffic sensors across the network, and (2) the coexistence of multi-scale periodic patterns (e.g., daily and weekly periodic patterns driven by human routines) with irregular fluctuations caused by unpredictable events (e.g., accidents, weather, or construction). To tackle these challenges, we propose HyperD (Hybrid Periodic Decoupling), a novel framework that decouples traffic data into periodic and residual components. The periodic component is handled by the Hybrid Periodic Representation Module, which extracts fine-grained daily and weekly patterns using learnable periodic embeddings and spatial-temporal attention. The residual component, which captures non-periodic, high-frequency fluctuations, is modeled by the Frequency-Aware Residual Representation Module, leveraging complex-valued MLP in frequency domain. To enforce semantic separation between the two components, we further introduce a Dual-View Alignment Loss, which aligns low-frequency information with the periodic branch and high-frequency information with the residual branch. Extensive experiments on four real-world traffic datasets demonstrate that HyperD achieves state-of-the-art prediction accuracy, while offering superior robustness under disturbances and improved computational efficiency compared to existing methods.

AI.tldr: HyperD是一种新颖的交通预测框架，它将交通数据解耦为周期性和残差分量，并分别处理，以有效应对复杂的空间依赖性和多尺度周期模式与不规则波动共存的挑战。
AI.motivation: 准确的交通预测对智能交通系统至关重要，但由于路段和传感器之间复杂的空间依赖性，以及日常和每周周期模式与事故、天气等不可预测事件引起的不规则波动并存，交通预测仍然充满挑战。
AI.method: HyperD框架将交通数据解耦为周期性分量和残差分量。周期性分量由混合周期表示模块处理，该模块使用可学习的周期嵌入和时空注意力提取细粒度的日常和每周模式。残差分量（捕获非周期性高频波动）由频率感知残差表示模块通过频域中的复值MLP建模。此外，引入双视图对齐损失，将低频信息与周期分支对齐，高频信息与残差分支对齐，以强制实现语义分离。
AI.result: 在四个真实世界交通数据集上的大量实验表明，HyperD实现了最先进的预测精度，并且在干扰下表现出卓越的鲁棒性，同时与现有方法相比提高了计算效率。
AI.conclusion: HyperD通过有效解耦交通数据中的周期性和非周期性模式，为准确、鲁棒和高效的交通预测提供了一个强大的解决方案，在智能交通系统中具有巨大潜力。

title: TiDAR: Think in Diffusion, Talk in Autoregression
summary: Diffusion language models hold the promise of fast parallel generation, while autoregressive (AR) models typically excel in quality due to their causal structure aligning naturally with language modeling. This raises a fundamental question: can we achieve a synergy with high throughput, higher GPU utilization, and AR level quality? Existing methods fail to effectively balance these two aspects, either prioritizing AR using a weaker model for sequential drafting (speculative decoding), leading to lower drafting efficiency, or using some form of left-to-right (AR-like) decoding logic for diffusion, which still suffers from quality degradation and forfeits its potential parallelizability. We introduce TiDAR, a sequence-level hybrid architecture that drafts tokens (Thinking) in Diffusion and samples final outputs (Talking) AutoRegressively - all within a single forward pass using specially designed structured attention masks. This design exploits the free GPU compute density, achieving a strong balance between drafting and verification capacity. Moreover, TiDAR is designed to be serving-friendly (low overhead) as a standalone model. We extensively evaluate TiDAR against AR models, speculative decoding, and diffusion variants across generative and likelihood tasks at 1.5B and 8B scales. Thanks to the parallel drafting and sampling as well as exact KV cache support, TiDAR outperforms speculative decoding in measured throughput and surpasses diffusion models like Dream and Llada in both efficiency and quality. Most notably, TiDAR is the first architecture to close the quality gap with AR models while delivering 4.71x to 5.91x more tokens per second.

AI.tldr: TiDAR是一种混合架构，结合了扩散模型的并行草稿生成和自回归模型的最终采样，在一个前向传播中实现高吞吐量和自回归模型级别的生成质量。
AI.motivation: 扩散语言模型承诺快速并行生成，而自回归（AR）模型因其因果结构与语言建模自然契合而通常在质量上表现出色。现有方法未能有效平衡这两个方面，导致草稿效率低或质量下降，并且牺牲了并行性。研究旨在解决如何同时实现高吞吐量、高GPU利用率和AR级别质量的问题。
AI.method: TiDAR引入了一种序列级混合架构，在一个前向传播中通过专门设计的结构化注意力掩码来“思考”（扩散式草稿生成）和“表达”（自回归式最终采样）。这种设计利用了GPU计算密度，平衡了草稿生成和验证能力，并且作为独立模型易于部署（低开销）。
AI.result: TiDAR在1.5B和8B规模的生成和似然任务中，吞吐量优于推测解码，效率和质量优于Dream和Llada等扩散模型。最显著的是，TiDAR是第一个在保持AR模型质量水平的同时，将每秒生成的token数量提高了4.71到5.91倍的架构。
AI.conclusion: TiDAR成功弥合了扩散模型和自回归模型之间的差距，首次在保持自回归模型高质量的同时，显著提升了语言模型的生成吞吐量，实现了高吞吐量和AR级别质量的协同效应。

title: From Model Training to Model Raising -- A call to reform AI model training paradigms from post-hoc alignment to intrinsic, identity-based development
comment: Accepted for publication in Communications of the ACM (CACM), Opinion section
summary: Current AI training methods align models with human values only after their core capabilities have been established, resulting in models that are easily misaligned and lack deep-rooted value systems. We propose a paradigm shift from "model training" to "model raising", in which alignment is woven into a model's development from the start. We identify several key components for this paradigm, all centered around redesigning the training corpus: reframing training data from a first-person perspective, recontextualizing information as lived experience, simulating social interactions, and scaffolding the ordering of training data. We expect that this redesign of the training corpus will lead to an early commitment to values from the first training token onward, such that knowledge, skills, and values are intrinsically much harder to separate. In an ecosystem in which large language model capabilities start overtaking human capabilities in many tasks, this seems to us like a critical need.

AI.tldr: 本文提出将AI训练范式从“模型训练”转变为“模型培养”，通过从一开始就将价值观对齐融入模型开发，特别是通过重新设计训练语料库，以实现模型价值观的早期内化。
AI.motivation: 当前的AI训练方法在模型核心能力建立后才进行价值观对齐，导致模型容易失调且缺乏深层次的价值观体系。随着大型语言模型能力超越人类，这种缺陷变得尤为关键。
AI.method: 核心方法是重新设计训练语料库，包括：将训练数据重新构建为第一人称视角、将信息重新情境化为生活经验、模拟社交互动以及对训练数据的排序进行支架式引导。
AI.result: 预期结果是模型从第一个训练token开始就对价值观有早期承诺，使得知识、技能和价值观在本质上更难分离。
AI.conclusion: 这种从“模型训练”到“模型培养”的范式转变，被认为是AI发展中的一个关键需求，特别是在大型语言模型能力日益强大的背景下。

title: Improving VisNet for Object Recognition
summary:
Object recognition plays a fundamental role in how biological organisms perceive and interact with their environment. While the human visual system performs this task with remarkable efficiency, reproducing similar capabilities in artificial systems remains challenging. This study investigates VisNet, a biologically inspired neural network model, and several enhanced variants incorporating radial basis function neurons, Mahalanobis distance based learning, and retinal like preprocessing for both general object recognition and symmetry classification. By leveraging principles of Hebbian learning and temporal continuity associating temporally adjacent views to build invariant representations. VisNet and its extensions capture robust and transformation invariant features. Experimental results across multiple datasets, including MNIST, CIFAR10, and custom symmetric object sets, show that these enhanced VisNet variants substantially improve recognition accuracy compared with the baseline model. These findings underscore the adaptability and biological relevance of VisNet inspired architectures, offering a powerful and interpretable framework for visual recognition in both neuroscience and artificial intelligence.
  Keywords: VisNet, Object Recognition, Symmetry Detection, Hebbian Learning, RBF Neurons, Mahalanobis Distance, Biologically Inspired Models, Invariant Representations

AI.tldr: 本研究通过结合径向基函数神经元、马哈拉诺比斯距离学习和视网膜预处理等增强功能，改进了受生物启发的VisNet模型，显著提高了物体识别和对称性分类的准确性，强调了其生物学相关性和可解释性。
AI.motivation: 生物有机体在物体识别方面表现出卓越的效率，而人工系统复制这种能力仍面临挑战。本研究旨在探索并改进受生物启发的VisNet模型，以期在人工系统中实现类似人类视觉系统的强大识别能力。
AI.method: 研究调查了VisNet模型及其几个增强变体，这些变体结合了径向基函数神经元、基于马哈拉诺比斯距离的学习以及视网膜状预处理。模型利用赫布学习和时间连续性原理，通过关联时间上相邻的视图来构建不变表示。实验在MNIST、CIFAR10和自定义对称物体数据集上进行。
AI.result: 在多个数据集（包括MNIST、CIFAR10和自定义对称物体集）上的实验结果表明，与基线模型相比，这些增强型VisNet变体在识别准确性方面取得了显著提高。
AI.conclusion: 这些发现强调了VisNet启发式架构的适应性和生物学相关性，为神经科学和人工智能领域的视觉识别提供了一个强大且可解释的框架。

title: Consistency Change Detection Framework for Unsupervised Remote Sensing Change Detection
comment: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Multimedia and Expo (ICME)
summary: Unsupervised remote sensing change detection aims to monitor and analyze changes from multi-temporal remote sensing images in the same geometric region at different times, without the need for labeled training data. Previous unsupervised methods attempt to achieve style transfer across multi-temporal remote sensing images through reconstruction by a generator network, and then capture the unreconstructable areas as the changed regions. However, it often leads to poor performance due to generator overfitting. In this paper, we propose a novel Consistency Change Detection Framework (CCDF) to address this challenge. Specifically, we introduce a Cycle Consistency (CC) module to reduce the overfitting issues in the generator-based reconstruction. Additionally, we propose a Semantic Consistency (SC) module to enable detail reconstruction. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our method outperforms other state-of-the-art approaches.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为一致性变化检测框架（CCDF）的新方法，通过引入循环一致性（CC）和语义一致性（SC）模块，解决了无监督遥感变化检测中生成器过拟合导致性能不佳的问题。
AI.motivation: 以往的无监督遥感变化检测方法通过生成器网络进行图像重建来实现多时相图像的风格迁移，并将无法重建的区域识别为变化区域。然而，这种方法常因生成器过拟合而导致性能不佳。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种新颖的一致性变化检测框架（CCDF）。具体来说，引入了循环一致性（CC）模块以减少基于生成器重建中的过拟合问题，并提出了语义一致性（SC）模块以实现细节重建。
AI.result: 广泛的实验表明，该方法优于其他最先进的方法。
AI.conclusion: CCDF框架通过其循环一致性（CC）和语义一致性（SC）模块，有效解决了无监督遥感变化检测中生成器过拟合的挑战，并提高了检测性能。

title: Robust Estimation and Control for Heterogeneous Multi-agent Systems Based on Decentralized k-hop Prescribed Performance Observers
comment: This paper has been submitted for consideration to the 24th European Control Conference (ECC)
summary: We propose decentralized k-hop Prescribed Performance State and Input Observers for heterogeneous multi-agent systems subject to bounded external disturbances. In the proposed input/state observer, each agent estimates the state and input of agents located two or more hops away using only local information exchanged with 1-hop neighbors, while guaranteeing that transient estimation errors satisfy predefined performance bounds. Conditions are established under which the input observer can be omitted, allowing the state observer convergence to be independent of the input estimates. Theoretical analysis demonstrates that if a closed-loop controller with full state knowledge achieves the control objective and the estimation-based closed-loop system is set-Input to State Stable (set-ISS) with respect to the goal set, then the estimated states can be used to achieve the system objective with an arbitrarily small worst-case error governed by the accuracy of the states estimates. Simulation results are provided to validate the proposed approach.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种针对异构多智能体系统的去中心化k跳预设性能状态和输入观测器，它仅利用局部信息估计远距离智能体的状态和输入，并保证瞬态估计误差满足预设性能界限。
AI.motivation: 在多智能体系统中，需要一种去中心化的方法来估计远程（k跳）智能体的状态和输入，同时应对有界外部扰动，并确保估计误差在预设范围内。
AI.method: 提出去中心化k跳预设性能状态和输入观测器，其中每个智能体仅通过与1跳邻居交换信息来估计距离2跳或更远的智能体的状态和输入。该方法保证瞬态估计误差满足预设性能界限。同时，建立了可以省略输入观测器的条件。理论分析基于估计闭环系统相对于目标集的集输入到状态稳定性（set-ISS）。
AI.result: 所提出的观测器能够让每个智能体仅利用局部信息估计k跳以外智能体的状态和输入，并保证瞬态估计误差满足预设性能。在特定条件下，输入观测器可以被省略，使得状态观测器的收敛独立于输入估计。理论分析表明，如果一个具有完整状态知识的闭环控制器能够实现控制目标，并且基于估计的闭环系统相对于目标集是集-ISS的，那么估计状态可以用于实现系统目标，且最坏情况误差可以任意小。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的去中心化k跳预设性能状态和输入观测器能够有效估计异构多智能体系统的状态和输入，保证了估计性能，并使得利用估计状态实现系统目标成为可能，且误差可控。仿真结果验证了该方法的有效性。

title: EVADE: LLM-Based Explanation Generation and Validation for Error Detection in NLI
summary: High-quality datasets are critical for training and evaluating reliable NLP models. In tasks like natural language inference (NLI), human label variation (HLV) arises when multiple labels are valid for the same instance, making it difficult to separate annotation errors from plausible variation. An earlier framework VARIERR (Weber-Genzel et al., 2024) asks multiple annotators to explain their label decisions in the first round and flag errors via validity judgments in the second round. However, conducting two rounds of manual annotation is costly and may limit the coverage of plausible labels or explanations. Our study proposes a new framework, EVADE, for generating and validating explanations to detect errors using large language models (LLMs). We perform a comprehensive analysis comparing human- and LLM-detected errors for NLI across distribution comparison, validation overlap, and impact on model fine-tuning. Our experiments demonstrate that LLM validation refines generated explanation distributions to more closely align with human annotations, and that removing LLM-detected errors from training data yields improvements in fine-tuning performance than removing errors identified by human annotators. This highlights the potential to scale error detection, reducing human effort while improving dataset quality under label variation.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出EVADE框架，利用大型语言模型(LLMs)生成并验证解释，以检测自然语言推理(NLI)数据集中因人类标签变异导致的错误，结果显示LLM检测的错误移除后能更有效地提升模型微调性能。
AI.motivation: 高质量数据集对训练可靠的NLP模型至关重要。在NLI等任务中，人类标签变异(HLV)使得区分标注错误和合理变异变得困难。现有框架（如VARIERR）需要多轮人工标注，成本高昂且可能限制解释的覆盖范围。
AI.method: 本研究提出了EVADE框架，利用LLMs生成并验证解释以检测错误。通过对NLI任务进行全面分析，比较了人类和LLM检测到的错误在分布比较、验证重叠以及对模型微调影响方面的差异。
AI.result: 实验表明，LLM验证能使生成的解释分布与人类标注更紧密地对齐。从训练数据中移除LLM检测到的错误比移除人类标注者识别的错误能带来更显著的微调性能提升。
AI.conclusion: 本研究突出了LLMs在错误检测方面的潜力，能够减少人工投入，同时在标签变异条件下提高数据集质量，实现错误检测的规模化。

title: SPIDER: Scalable Physics-Informed Dexterous Retargeting
summary: Learning dexterous and agile policy for humanoid and dexterous hand control requires large-scale demonstrations, but collecting robot-specific data is prohibitively expensive. In contrast, abundant human motion data is readily available from motion capture, videos, and virtual reality, which could help address the data scarcity problem. However, due to the embodiment gap and missing dynamic information like force and torque, these demonstrations cannot be directly executed on robots. To bridge this gap, we propose Scalable Physics-Informed DExterous Retargeting (SPIDER), a physics-based retargeting framework to transform and augment kinematic-only human demonstrations to dynamically feasible robot trajectories at scale. Our key insight is that human demonstrations should provide global task structure and objective, while large-scale physics-based sampling with curriculum-style virtual contact guidance should refine trajectories to ensure dynamical feasibility and correct contact sequences. SPIDER scales across diverse 9 humanoid/dexterous hand embodiments and 6 datasets, improving success rates by 18% compared to standard sampling, while being 10X faster than reinforcement learning (RL) baselines, and enabling the generation of a 2.4M frames dynamic-feasible robot dataset for policy learning. As a universal physics-based retargeting method, SPIDER can work with diverse quality data and generate diverse and high-quality data to enable efficient policy learning with methods like RL.

AI.tldr: SPIDER是一个可扩展的物理信息灵巧重定向框架，它能将大规模的仅有运动学信息的人类演示数据转换为机器人可执行的、动态可行的轨迹，以弥合人机形态差异并加速策略学习。
AI.motivation: 学习人形机器人和灵巧手控制策略需要大量机器人特定数据，但收集成本极高。相比之下，人类运动数据丰富但无法直接用于机器人，因为存在形态差异且缺少力矩等动力学信息。
AI.method: 本文提出了SPIDER（Scalable Physics-Informed DExterous Retargeting），一个物理基础的重定向框架。其核心思想是利用人类演示提供全局任务结构和目标，并通过大规模的物理采样结合课程式虚拟接触引导来精炼轨迹，确保动态可行性和正确的接触序列。
AI.result: SPIDER在9种不同的人形/灵巧手形态和6个数据集中表现出良好的可扩展性，相比标准采样方法成功率提升18%，且比强化学习基线快10倍。它成功生成了一个包含2.4M帧的动态可行机器人数据集，用于策略学习。
AI.conclusion: SPIDER是一个通用的物理基础重定向方法，能够处理不同质量的数据，并生成多样化、高质量的动态可行机器人数据，从而有效支持强化学习等策略学习方法。

title: CoRL-MPPI: Enhancing MPPI With Learnable Behaviours For Efficient And Provably-Safe Multi-Robot Collision Avoidance
comment: The manuscript includes 9 pages, 4 figures, and 1 table
summary: Decentralized collision avoidance remains a core challenge for scalable multi-robot systems. One of the promising approaches to tackle this problem is Model Predictive Path Integral (MPPI) -- a framework that is naturally suited to handle any robot motion model and provides strong theoretical guarantees. Still, in practice MPPI-based controller may provide suboptimal trajectories as its performance relies heavily on uninformed random sampling. In this work, we introduce CoRL-MPPI, a novel fusion of Cooperative Reinforcement Learning and MPPI to address this limitation. We train an action policy (approximated as deep neural network) in simulation that learns local cooperative collision avoidance behaviors. This learned policy is then embedded into the MPPI framework to guide its sampling distribution, biasing it towards more intelligent and cooperative actions. Notably, CoRL-MPPI preserves all the theoretical guarantees of regular MPPI. We evaluate our approach in dense, dynamic simulation environments against state-of-the-art baselines, including ORCA, BVC, and a multi-agent MPPI implementation. Our results demonstrate that CoRL-MPPI significantly improves navigation efficiency (measured by success rate and makespan) and safety, enabling agile and robust multi-robot navigation.

AI.tldr: 本文提出CoRL-MPPI，一种融合合作强化学习与MPPI的多机器人分散式避碰方法，通过学习策略引导采样，显著提升导航效率和安全性。
AI.motivation: 分散式避碰是多机器人系统面临的核心挑战。MPPI虽有理论保障且适用各种机器人运动模型，但其实际性能受限于无信息随机采样，可能导致次优轨迹。
AI.method: 本文引入CoRL-MPPI，将合作强化学习与MPPI融合。在模拟环境中训练一个学习局部合作避碰行为的动作策略（用深度神经网络近似），然后将其嵌入MPPI框架以引导采样分布，使其偏向更智能和合作的动作。CoRL-MPPI保留了常规MPPI的所有理论保证。
AI.result: 在密集、动态的模拟环境中，与ORCA、BVC和多智能体MPPI等现有先进基线相比，CoRL-MPPI显著提高了导航效率（通过成功率和完成时间衡量）和安全性，实现了敏捷且鲁棒的多机器人导航。
AI.conclusion: CoRL-MPPI通过将学习到的合作行为融入MPPI的采样过程，有效解决了MPPI在多机器人分散式避碰中的局限性，实现了更高效、更安全的导航，为多机器人系统提供了强大的解决方案。

title: Investigation of resonance between HVDC-MMC link and AC network
summary: HVDC networks offer several advantages over traditional HVAC systems, particularly for long-distance power transmission and integration of renewable energy sources, such as reduced losses and enhanced stability and control, but also increase the risk of oscillations. This study investigates electrical resonant phenomena associated with HVDC stations through numerical EMT simulations. The findings indicate that electrical resonance is primarily pronounced in weak networks with long cables, as confirmed by the Nyquist criterion applied to frequency responses. Two real cases were successfully simulated in the time domain by introducing network changes, such as temporary faults and alterations in network's power strength, to activate the identified resonances. Notably, in a strong network with short cables, electrical resonance occurred alongside interactions between the network and the converter's protection system. The analysis of voltage waveforms revealed that the amplitude of the induced resonant harmonic dissipates quickly, indicating sufficient damping in the network configuration. Furthermore, the study confirmed the network's sensitivity to changes in converter parameters modeled using available MMC model.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过EMT仿真调查了高压直流(HVDC)站的电谐振现象，发现在弱网络和长电缆条件下谐振显著，但在强网络中谐振可能与保护系统相互作用，且谐振谐波衰减迅速，网络对换流器参数敏感。
AI.motivation: 高压直流(HVDC)网络在长距离输电和可再生能源整合方面具有优势（如损耗降低、稳定性增强），但同时也增加了振荡风险。因此，研究与HVDC站相关的电谐振现象至关重要。
AI.method: 本研究采用数值电磁暂态(EMT)仿真来调查电谐振现象。通过将奈奎斯特判据应用于频率响应来确认谐振，并通过在时域中引入暂态故障和改变网络强度来激活和模拟实际案例中的谐振。此外，还使用了可用的MMC模型来评估网络对换流器参数变化的敏感性。
AI.result: 研究发现，电谐振主要在弱网络和长电缆条件下表现显著。在强网络和短电缆条件下，电谐振与网络和换流器保护系统之间存在相互作用。电压波形分析显示，感应谐振谐波的幅度衰减迅速，表明网络配置中存在足够的阻尼。此外，研究证实了网络对使用MMC模型建模的换流器参数变化的敏感性。
AI.conclusion: 本研究确认了HVDC网络中电谐振的存在及其主要发生条件。尽管在某些情况下谐振可能与保护系统相互作用，但网络配置中的阻尼足以使感应谐振谐波迅速衰减。同时，网络对换流器参数的变化表现出敏感性。

title: HitoMi-Cam: A Shape-Agnostic Person Detection Method Using the Spectral Characteristics of Clothing
comment: 37 pages, 21 figures, 9 tables. Published in MDPI Journal of Imaging. Includes 1 supplementary video file (ancillary file)
summary: While convolutional neural network (CNN)-based object detection is widely used, it exhibits a shape dependency that degrades performance for postures not included in the training data. Building upon our previous simulation study published in this journal, this study implements and evaluates the spectral-based approach on physical hardware to address this limitation. Specifically, this paper introduces HitoMi-Cam, a lightweight and shape-agnostic person detection method that uses the spectral reflectance properties of clothing. The author implemented the system on a resource-constrained edge device without a GPU to assess its practical viability. The results indicate that a processing speed of 23.2 frames per second (fps) (253x190 pixels) is achievable, suggesting that the method can be used for real-time applications. In a simulated search and rescue scenario where the performance of CNNs declines, HitoMi-Cam achieved an average precision (AP) of 93.5%, surpassing that of the compared CNN models (best AP of 53.8%). Throughout all evaluation scenarios, the occurrence of false positives remained minimal. This study positions the HitoMi-Cam method not as a replacement for CNN-based detectors but as a complementary tool under specific conditions. The results indicate that spectral-based person detection can be a viable option for real-time operation on edge devices in real-world environments where shapes are unpredictable, such as disaster rescue.

AI.tldr: 本研究在物理硬件上实现了HitoMi-Cam，一种基于服装光谱反射特性的轻量级、形状无关的人物检测方法，解决了传统CNN在姿态多变场景下的性能下降问题，并在边缘设备上实现了实时高性能检测。
AI.motivation: 卷积神经网络（CNN）目标检测存在形状依赖性，导致在训练数据未包含的姿态下性能下降，特别是在灾难救援等形状不可预测的场景中。本研究旨在开发一种不受形状影响的鲁棒人物检测方法。
AI.method: 本研究基于先前发表的仿真研究，在物理硬件上实现了并评估了一种基于光谱的方法。具体引入了HitoMi-Cam，它利用衣物的光谱反射特性进行人物检测，并在没有GPU的资源受限边缘设备上进行了系统实现和评估。
AI.result: HitoMi-Cam在253x190像素下实现了23.2帧/秒的处理速度，表明其可用于实时应用。在模拟搜索和救援场景中，HitoMi-Cam的平均精度（AP）达到93.5%，远超对比CNN模型（最佳AP为53.8%）。在所有评估场景中，误报率极低。
AI.conclusion: HitoMi-Cam方法并非CNN检测器的替代品，而是在特定条件下（如灾难救援中形状不可预测的环境）的有效补充工具。研究结果表明，基于光谱的人物检测是边缘设备在真实世界环境中进行实时操作的可行选择。

title: BarrierBench : Evaluating Large Language Models for Safety Verification in Dynamical Systems
summary:
Safety verification of dynamical systems via barrier certificates is essential for ensuring correctness in autonomous applications. Synthesizing these certificates involves discovering mathematical functions with current methods suffering from poor scalability, dependence on carefully designed templates, and exhaustive or incremental function-space searches. They also demand substantial manual expertise--selecting templates, solvers, and hyperparameters, and designing sampling strategies--requiring both theoretical and practical knowledge traditionally shared through linguistic reasoning rather than formalized methods.
  This motivates a key question: can such expert reasoning be captured and operationalized by language models? We address this by introducing an LLM-based agentic framework for barrier certificate synthesis. The framework uses natural language reasoning to propose, refine, and validate candidate certificates, integrating LLM-driven template discovery with SMT-based verification, and supporting barrier-controller co-synthesis to ensure consistency between safety certificates and controllers.
  To evaluate this capability, we introduce BarrierBench, a benchmark of 100 dynamical systems spanning linear, nonlinear, discrete-time, and continuous-time settings. Our experiments assess not only the effectiveness of LLM-guided barrier synthesis but also the utility of retrieval-augmented generation and agentic coordination strategies in improving its reliability and performance. Across these tasks, the framework achieves more than 90% success in generating valid certificates. By releasing BarrierBench and the accompanying toolchain, we aim to establish a community testbed for advancing the integration of language-based reasoning with formal verification in dynamical systems.
  The benchmark is publicly available at https://hycodev.com/dataset/barrierbench

AI.tldr: 本文提出一个基于LLM的智能体框架，通过自然语言推理自动合成动态系统的障碍证书，解决了传统方法可扩展性差和对专家知识依赖的问题，并在新基准BarrierBench上取得了超过90%的成功率。
AI.motivation: 现有障碍证书合成方法面临可扩展性差、过度依赖精心设计的模板、需要详尽或增量式的函数空间搜索等问题。此外，这些方法还需要大量人工专业知识（选择模板、求解器、超参数、采样策略），而这些知识传统上通过语言推理而非形式化方法共享，这促使研究者思考语言模型是否能捕获并操作这些专家推理。
AI.method: 研究者引入了一个基于LLM的智能体框架，用于障碍证书合成。该框架利用自然语言推理来提出、完善和验证候选证书，将LLM驱动的模板发现与基于SMT的验证相结合，并支持障碍控制器协同合成以确保安全证书与控制器之间的一致性。同时，他们还引入了BarrierBench，一个包含100个动态系统的基准，用于评估该框架的有效性，并评估了检索增强生成（RAG）和智能体协调策略的实用性。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，该框架在生成有效证书方面取得了超过90%的成功率。研究还证实了检索增强生成和智能体协调策略在提高系统可靠性和性能方面的效用。
AI.conclusion: 该研究成功地将语言模型驱动的推理与动态系统的形式化验证相结合，提供了一个高效且自动化的障碍证书合成方法。通过发布BarrierBench及其配套工具链，旨在为社区建立一个测试平台，以推动语言推理与形式化验证在动态系统中的进一步融合。

title: SpiralThinker: Latent Reasoning through an Iterative Process with Text-Latent Interleaving
summary: Recent advances in large reasoning models have been driven by reinforcement learning and test-time scaling, accompanied by growing interest in latent rather than purely textual reasoning. However, existing latent reasoning methods lack mechanisms to ensure stable evolution of latent representations and a systematic way to interleave implicit and explicit reasoning. We introduce SpiralThinker, a unified framework that performs iterative updates over latent representations, enabling extended implicit reasoning without generating additional tokens. A progressive alignment objective combined with structured annotations maintains coherence between latent and textual reasoning. Across mathematical, logical, and commonsense reasoning tasks, SpiralThinker achieves the best overall performance among latent reasoning approaches, consistently surpassing previous methods across all benchmarks. Detailed analyses reveal that both iteration and alignment are indispensable, the numbers of latent tokens and iterations exhibit dataset-specific optima, and appropriate alignment proves critical for an effective iterative process. Overall, SpiralThinker bridges iterative computation and latent reasoning, demonstrating that aligned iterative updates can reliably steer reasoning in the latent space.

AI.tldr: SpiralThinker是一个统一的潜在推理框架，通过迭代更新潜在表示和渐进对齐目标，在不生成额外tokens的情况下实现扩展的隐式推理，并在多个推理任务中超越现有方法。
AI.motivation: 现有潜在推理方法缺乏确保潜在表示稳定演化的机制，也缺乏系统地交织隐式和显式推理的方法。
AI.method: SpiralThinker采用迭代更新潜在表示的方式进行扩展隐式推理，无需生成额外tokens。它结合渐进对齐目标和结构化标注，以保持潜在推理和文本推理之间的一致性。
AI.result: SpiralThinker在数学、逻辑和常识推理任务中取得了潜在推理方法的最佳整体性能，并持续超越所有基准上的现有方法。分析表明，迭代和对齐都不可或缺，潜在tokens和迭代次数存在数据集特定的最优值，且适当的对齐对于有效的迭代过程至关重要。
AI.conclusion: SpiralThinker连接了迭代计算和潜在推理，证明了对齐的迭代更新可以可靠地引导潜在空间中的推理。

title: WMPO: World Model-based Policy Optimization for Vision-Language-Action Models
summary: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models have shown strong potential for general-purpose robotic manipulation, but their reliance on expert demonstrations limits their ability to learn from failures and perform self-corrections. Reinforcement learning (RL) addresses these through self-improving interactions with the physical environment, but suffers from high sample complexity on real robots. We introduce World-Model-based Policy Optimization (WMPO), a principled framework for on-policy VLA RL without interacting with the real environment. In contrast to widely used latent world models, WMPO focuses on pixel-based predictions that align the "imagined" trajectories with the VLA features pretrained with web-scale images. Crucially, WMPO enables the policy to perform on-policy GRPO that provides stronger performance than the often-used off-policy methods. Extensive experiments in both simulation and real-robot settings demonstrate that WMPO (i) substantially improves sample efficiency, (ii) achieves stronger overall performance, (iii) exhibits emergent behaviors such as self-correction, and (iv) demonstrates robust generalization and lifelong learning capabilities.

AI.tldr: WMPO是一种基于世界模型的策略优化框架，通过像素级预测和预训练VLA特征，实现无需真实环境交互的在线VLA强化学习，显著提高了样本效率和性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的视觉-语言-动作（VLA）模型依赖专家演示，难以从失败中学习和自我修正。强化学习（RL）虽能解决此问题，但在真实机器人上样本效率低。
AI.method: 本文提出了World-Model-based Policy Optimization (WMPO) 框架。与常用的潜在世界模型不同，WMPO专注于像素级预测，将“想象”的轨迹与通过网络规模图像预训练的VLA特征对齐。这使得策略能够执行在线的GRPO（一种策略梯度优化方法），而非常用的离线方法。
AI.result: WMPO在仿真和真实机器人实验中表现出：(i) 大幅提升样本效率，(ii) 实现更强的整体性能，(iii) 展现出自我修正等新兴行为，以及 (iv) 具有鲁棒的泛化和终身学习能力。
AI.conclusion: WMPO提供了一个原则性的框架，通过在不与真实环境交互的情况下进行在线VLA强化学习，克服了现有VLA模型和传统RL方法的局限性，实现了高效、强大且能自我修正的机器人操作能力。

title: Negative Entity Suppression for Zero-Shot Captioning with Synthetic Images
summary: Text-only training provides an attractive approach to address data scarcity challenges in zero-shot image captioning (ZIC), avoiding the expense of collecting paired image-text annotations. However, although these approaches perform well within training domains, they suffer from poor cross-domain generalization, often producing hallucinated content when encountering novel visual environments. Retrieval-based methods attempt to mitigate this limitation by leveraging external knowledge, but they can paradoxically exacerbate hallucination when retrieved captions contain entities irrelevant to the inputs. We introduce the concept of negative entities--objects that appear in generated caption but are absent from the input--and propose Negative Entity Suppression (NES) to tackle this challenge. NES seamlessly integrates three stages: (1) it employs synthetic images to ensure consistent image-to-text retrieval across both training and inference; (2) it filters negative entities from retrieved content to enhance accuracy; and (3) it applies attention-level suppression using identified negative entities to further minimize the impact of hallucination-prone features. Evaluation across multiple benchmarks demonstrates that NES maintains competitive in-domain performance while improving cross-domain transfer and reducing hallucination rates, achieving new state-of-the-art results in ZIC. Our code is available at https://github.com/nidongpinyinme/NESCap.

AI.tldr: 本文提出负实体抑制（NES）方法，通过引入负实体概念并分三阶段处理，有效减少零样本图像字幕（ZIC）中的幻觉现象，提升跨领域泛化能力。
AI.motivation: 零样本图像字幕（ZIC）中的纯文本训练方法面临跨领域泛化差和内容幻觉问题。虽然基于检索的方法试图缓解，但检索到的不相关内容反而可能加剧幻觉。
AI.method: 引入“负实体”概念（生成字幕中出现但输入图像中不存在的物体），并提出负实体抑制（NES）方法。NES包含三个阶段：1) 使用合成图像确保训练和推理阶段图像到文本检索的一致性；2) 过滤检索内容中的负实体以提高准确性；3) 利用识别出的负实体进行注意力层面的抑制，进一步减少易产生幻觉特征的影响。
AI.result: NES在多个基准测试中表现出有竞争力的域内性能，同时显著改善了跨领域迁移能力并降低了幻觉率，在ZIC领域取得了新的最先进（SOTA）成果。
AI.conclusion: NES通过识别和抑制负实体，有效解决了零样本图像字幕中的幻觉问题，显著提升了模型的跨领域泛化能力和生成内容的准确性。

title: MAP-VLA: Memory-Augmented Prompting for Vision-Language-Action Model in Robotic Manipulation
summary: Pre-trained Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models have achieved remarkable success in improving robustness and generalization for end-to-end robotic manipulation. However, these models struggle with long-horizon tasks due to their lack of memory and reliance solely on immediate sensory inputs. To address this limitation, we propose Memory-Augmented Prompting for Vision-Language-Action model (MAP-VLA), a novel framework that empowers pre-trained VLA models with demonstration-derived memory prompts to augment action generation for long-horizon robotic manipulation tasks. To achieve this, MAP-VLA first constructs a memory library from historical demonstrations, where each memory unit captures information about a specific stage of a task. These memory units are implemented as learnable soft prompts optimized through prompt tuning. Then, during real-time task execution, MAP-VLA retrieves relevant memory through trajectory similarity matching and dynamically integrates it into the VLA model for augmented action generation. Importantly, this prompt tuning and retrieval augmentation approach operates as a plug-and-play module for a frozen VLA model, offering a lightweight and flexible solution to improve task performance. Experimental results show that MAP-VLA delivers up to 7.0% absolute performance gains in the simulation benchmark and 25.0% on real robot evaluations for long-horizon tasks, surpassing the current state-of-the-art methods.

AI.tldr: MAP-VLA通过引入基于演示的记忆提示来增强预训练的视觉-语言-动作（VLA）模型，以解决其在长程任务中缺乏记忆的问题，显著提升了机器人操作的性能。
AI.motivation: 预训练的VLA模型在端到端机器人操作中表现出色，但在长程任务中因缺乏记忆且仅依赖即时感官输入而表现不佳。
AI.method: MAP-VLA首先从历史演示中构建一个记忆库，将每个任务阶段的信息封装为可学习的软提示。在任务执行期间，MAP-VLA通过轨迹相似性匹配检索相关记忆，并将其动态集成到冻结的VLA模型中，以增强动作生成。该方法是一个即插即用的模块。
AI.result: MAP-VLA在模拟基准测试中将长程任务的性能提升了7.0%，在真实机器人评估中提升了25.0%，超越了当前的先进方法。
AI.conclusion: MAP-VLA通过记忆增强提示为预训练VLA模型提供了一种轻量级、灵活的解决方案，有效解决了其在长程任务中的记忆限制，显著提高了任务性能。

title: The 2025 Planning Performance of Frontier Large Language Models
summary: The capacity of Large Language Models (LLMs) for reasoning remains an active area of research, with the capabilities of frontier models continually advancing. We provide an updated evaluation of the end-to-end planning performance of three frontier LLMs as of 2025, where models are prompted to generate a plan from PDDL domain and task descriptions. We evaluate DeepSeek R1, Gemini 2.5 Pro, GPT-5 and as reference the planner LAMA on a subset of domains from the most recent Learning Track of the International Planning Competition. Our results show that on standard PDDL domains, the performance of GPT-5 in terms of solved tasks is competitive with LAMA. When the PDDL domains and tasks are obfuscated to test for pure reasoning, the performance of all LLMs degrades, though less severely than previously reported for other models. These results show substantial improvements over prior generations of LLMs, reducing the performance gap to planners on a challenging benchmark.

AI.tldr: 该研究评估了DeepSeek R1、Gemini 2.5 Pro和GPT-5等前沿大型语言模型在PDDL规划任务上的端到端性能。结果显示，GPT-5在标准PDDL领域与传统规划器LAMA表现相当，且所有LLM在混淆任务上的性能下降程度低于以往模型，表明LLM在规划能力上取得了显著进步。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLM）的推理能力是一个活跃的研究领域，且前沿模型的能力持续提升。因此，需要对最新模型的端到端规划性能进行更新评估。
AI.method: 研究评估了DeepSeek R1、Gemini 2.5 Pro和GPT-5三款前沿LLM的端到端规划性能，并以LAMA规划器作为参考。模型被提示根据PDDL领域和任务描述生成规划。评估数据集选自国际规划竞赛最新学习轨迹的子集，包括标准PDDL领域和为测试纯粹推理而混淆的PDDL领域和任务。评估指标为解决任务的数量。
AI.result: 在标准PDDL领域，GPT-5在解决任务方面的表现与LAMA具有竞争力。当PDDL领域和任务被混淆以测试纯粹推理时，所有LLM的性能均有所下降，但下降程度远低于先前对其他模型的报告。这些结果表明，相较于前几代LLM，性能有显著提升，缩小了与传统规划器在挑战性基准上的性能差距。
AI.conclusion: 前沿LLM在端到端规划方面取得了实质性进展，尤其GPT-5在标准PDDL任务上已能与传统规划器LAMA相媲美。尽管在混淆任务上性能仍有下降，但其表现优于以往模型，表明LLM在规划和推理能力方面正持续进步，并逐步缩小与专用规划器之间的差距。

title: CrochetBench: Can Vision-Language Models Move from Describing to Doing in Crochet Domain?
summary: We present CrochetBench, a benchmark for evaluating the ability of multimodal large language models to perform fine-grained, low-level procedural reasoning in the domain of crochet. Unlike prior benchmarks that focus on high-level description or visual question answering, CrochetBench shifts the emphasis from describing to doing: models are required to recognize stitches, select structurally appropriate instructions, and generate compilable crochet procedures. We adopt the CrochetPARADE DSL as our intermediate representation, enabling structural validation and functional evaluation via execution. The benchmark covers tasks including stitch classification, instruction grounding, and both natural language and image-to-DSL translation. Across all tasks, performance sharply declines as the evaluation shifts from surface-level similarity to executable correctness, exposing limitations in long-range symbolic reasoning and 3D-aware procedural synthesis. CrochetBench offers a new lens for assessing procedural competence in multimodal models and highlights the gap between surface-level understanding and executable precision in real-world creative domains. Code is available at https://github.com/Peiyu-Georgia-Li/crochetBench.

AI.tldr: CrochetBench是一个评估多模态大语言模型在钩针编织领域进行细粒度、低级别程序推理能力的基准，专注于“做”而非仅仅描述，并通过DSL进行结构和功能验证。
AI.motivation: 现有基准主要侧重于高层描述或视觉问答，未能有效评估多模态大语言模型在真实世界创意领域中进行细粒度、低级别程序推理的实际操作能力。
AI.method: 本文提出了 CrochetBench 基准，要求模型识别针法、选择结构合适的指令并生成可编译的钩针程序。采用 CrochetPARADE DSL 作为中间表示，以实现结构验证和通过执行进行功能评估。基准涵盖了针法分类、指令接地以及自然语言和图像到 DSL 转换等任务。
AI.result: 在所有任务中，当评估从表面相似性转向可执行的正确性时，模型性能急剧下降，这暴露了模型在长程符号推理和3D感知程序合成方面的局限性。
AI.conclusion: CrochetBench 提供了一个评估多模态模型程序能力的新视角，并突出了表面理解与实际创意领域中可执行精度之间存在的显著差距。

title: Machines Serve Human: A Novel Variable Human-machine Collaborative Compression Framework
summary: Human-machine collaborative compression has been receiving increasing research efforts for reducing image/video data, serving as the basis for both human perception and machine intelligence. Existing collaborative methods are dominantly built upon the de facto human-vision compression pipeline, witnessing deficiency on complexity and bit-rates when aggregating the machine-vision compression. Indeed, machine vision solely focuses on the core regions within the image/video, requiring much less information compared with the compressed information for human vision. In this paper, we thus set out the first successful attempt by a novel collaborative compression method based on the machine-vision-oriented compression, instead of human-vision pipeline. In other words, machine vision serves as the basis for human vision within collaborative compression. A plug-and-play variable bit-rate strategy is also developed for machine vision tasks. Then, we propose to progressively aggregate the semantics from the machine-vision compression, whilst seamlessly tailing the diffusion prior to restore high-fidelity details for human vision, thus named as diffusion-prior based feature compression for human and machine visions (Diff-FCHM). Experimental results verify the consistently superior performances of our Diff-FCHM, on both machine-vision and human-vision compression with remarkable margins. Our code will be released upon acceptance.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Diff-FCHM的新型人机协作压缩方法，以机器视觉为基础，通过可变比特率策略和扩散先验，在显著降低复杂性和比特率的同时，实现了对机器视觉和人类视觉的卓越压缩性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的人机协作压缩方法主要基于人类视觉压缩流程，在整合机器视觉压缩时，在复杂度和比特率方面表现出不足。机器视觉仅关注图像/视频的核心区域，所需信息远少于人类视觉，因此需要一种更高效的、以机器视觉为导向的协作压缩方法。
AI.method: 本文首次尝试以机器视觉为基础构建协作压缩方法。首先，开发了一个即插即用的机器视觉任务可变比特率策略。然后，提出逐步聚合来自机器视觉压缩的语义信息，并无缝结合扩散先验来恢复人类视觉所需的高保真细节，该方法被命名为Diff-FCHM（Diffusion-prior based Feature Compression for Human and Machine Visions）。
AI.result: 实验结果验证了Diff-FCHM在机器视觉和人类视觉压缩方面都持续展现出显著优越的性能。
AI.conclusion: Diff-FCHM成功地建立了一种以机器视觉为基础的人机协作压缩范式，通过结合扩散先验，显著提升了压缩效率和质量，在人机协作压缩领域取得了突破性进展。

title: SpatialActor: Exploring Disentangled Spatial Representations for Robust Robotic Manipulation
summary: Robotic manipulation requires precise spatial understanding to interact with objects in the real world. Point-based methods suffer from sparse sampling, leading to the loss of fine-grained semantics. Image-based methods typically feed RGB and depth into 2D backbones pre-trained on 3D auxiliary tasks, but their entangled semantics and geometry are sensitive to inherent depth noise in real-world that disrupts semantic understanding. Moreover, these methods focus on high-level geometry while overlooking low-level spatial cues essential for precise interaction. We propose SpatialActor, a disentangled framework for robust robotic manipulation that explicitly decouples semantics and geometry. The Semantic-guided Geometric Module adaptively fuses two complementary geometry from noisy depth and semantic-guided expert priors. Also, a Spatial Transformer leverages low-level spatial cues for accurate 2D-3D mapping and enables interaction among spatial features. We evaluate SpatialActor on multiple simulation and real-world scenarios across 50+ tasks. It achieves state-of-the-art performance with 87.4% on RLBench and improves by 13.9% to 19.4% under varying noisy conditions, showing strong robustness. Moreover, it significantly enhances few-shot generalization to new tasks and maintains robustness under various spatial perturbations. Project Page: https://shihao1895.github.io/SpatialActor

AI.tldr: SpatialActor是一种解耦的机器人操作框架，通过分离语义和几何信息，并利用语义引导的几何融合模块和空间变换器处理低级空间线索，实现了对噪声鲁棒且高精度的机器人操作，在多项任务中达到SOTA性能。
AI.motivation: 机器人操作需要精确的空间理解。现有方法存在局限：基于点的方法采样稀疏，丢失细粒度语义；基于图像的方法将语义和几何纠缠，对深度噪声敏感，且忽略了精确交互所需的低级空间线索。
AI.method: 本文提出了SpatialActor，一个解耦的框架，明确地将语义和几何分离。它包含：1) 语义引导的几何模块，自适应地融合来自噪声深度和语义引导专家先验的两种互补几何信息；2) 空间变换器，利用低级空间线索进行精确的2D-3D映射，并促进空间特征之间的交互。
AI.result: SpatialActor在50多个模拟和真实世界任务中进行了评估。它在RLBench上取得了87.4%的最新性能，并在不同噪声条件下性能提升13.9%至19.4%，展现出强大的鲁棒性。此外，它显著增强了对新任务的少样本泛化能力，并在各种空间扰动下保持了鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: SpatialActor通过解耦语义和几何，并有效利用低级空间线索，为机器人操作提供了一个鲁棒且精确的解决方案。它在性能、噪声鲁棒性和少样本泛化方面均超越了现有方法。

title: What We Don't C: Representations for scientific discovery beyond VAEs
comment: Accepted to the Machine Learning and the Physical Sciences workshop at NeurIPS 2025
summary: Accessing information in learned representations is critical for scientific discovery in high-dimensional domains. We introduce a novel method based on latent flow matching with classifier-free guidance that disentangles latent subspaces by explicitly separating information included in conditioning from information that remains in the residual representation. Across three experiments -- a synthetic 2D Gaussian toy problem, colored MNIST, and the Galaxy10 astronomy dataset -- we show that our method enables access to meaningful features of high dimensional data. Our results highlight a simple yet powerful mechanism for analyzing, controlling, and repurposing latent representations, providing a pathway toward using generative models for scientific exploration of what we don't capture, consider, or catalog.

AI.tldr: 本文提出一种基于潜在流匹配和无分类器引导的新方法，通过显式分离条件信息和残差信息来解耦潜在子空间，从而在三项实验中有效地访问高维数据中有意义的特征，为科学探索提供了新途径。
AI.motivation: 在高维领域中，访问学习表示中的信息对于科学发现至关重要。研究旨在提供一种机制来分析、控制和重新利用潜在表示，以利用生成模型探索未捕获、未考虑或未分类的信息。
AI.method: 引入了一种基于潜在流匹配（latent flow matching）和无分类器引导（classifier-free guidance）的新方法。该方法通过显式分离条件中包含的信息和残差表示中保留的信息，来解耦潜在子空间。
AI.result: 该方法能够在高维数据中访问有意义的特征。在三个实验中得到了验证：一个合成的二维高斯玩具问题、彩色MNIST数据集和Galaxy10天文学数据集。
AI.conclusion: 该研究提供了一种简单而强大的机制来分析、控制和重新利用潜在表示，为使用生成模型进行科学探索（特别是探索我们未捕获、未考虑或未分类的信息）提供了途径。

title: Not Everything That Counts Can Be Counted: A Case for Safe Qualitative AI
comment: Accepted at 3rd International Conference on Frontiers of Artificial Intelligence, Ethics, and Multidisciplinary Applications (FAIEMA 2025)
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) and large language models (LLM) are reshaping science, with most recent advances culminating in fully-automated scientific discovery pipelines. But qualitative research has been left behind. Researchers in qualitative methods are hesitant about AI adoption. Yet when they are willing to use AI at all, they have little choice but to rely on general-purpose tools like ChatGPT to assist with interview interpretation, data annotation, and topic modeling - while simultaneously acknowledging these system's well-known limitations of being biased, opaque, irreproducible, and privacy-compromising. This creates a critical gap: while AI has substantially advanced quantitative methods, the qualitative dimensions essential for meaning-making and comprehensive scientific understanding remain poorly integrated. We argue for developing dedicated qualitative AI systems built from the ground up for interpretive research. Such systems must be transparent, reproducible, and privacy-friendly. We review recent literature to show how existing automated discovery pipelines could be enhanced by robust qualitative capabilities, and identify key opportunities where safe qualitative AI could advance multidisciplinary and mixed-methods research.

AI.tldr: 人工智能和大型语言模型正在重塑科学，但定性研究却被忽视。现有通用人工智能工具不适合定性研究，存在偏见、不透明和隐私问题。本研究主张开发专为解释性研究设计的、透明、可复现且注重隐私的定性人工智能系统。
AI.motivation: 人工智能和大型语言模型在科学发现方面取得了显著进展，但定性研究领域却未能充分受益。定性研究人员在使用人工智能时，只能依赖ChatGPT等通用工具，而这些工具存在偏见、不透明、不可复现和隐私泄露等已知局限性，导致人工智能在定性维度（对意义构建和全面科学理解至关重要）的应用上存在严重空白。
AI.method: 本文通过论证提出需要从头开始构建专门用于解释性研究的定性人工智能系统。同时，通过回顾现有文献，展示了如何通过鲁棒的定性能力来增强现有的自动化科学发现流程，并识别了安全定性人工智能在推进多学科和混合方法研究中的关键机遇。
AI.result: 研究揭示了人工智能在定性研究中的关键空白，并指出现有通用人工智能工具的局限性。它主张开发透明、可复现且注重隐私的专用定性人工智能系统，并指出这些系统能够增强现有的自动化发现流程，并促进多学科和混合方法研究的进步。
AI.conclusion: 为了弥补人工智能在定性研究中的不足，并实现全面科学理解，必须开发专为解释性研究设计的、透明、可复现且注重隐私的定性人工智能系统。这将有助于提升多学科和混合方法研究的能力。

title: Consensus Sampling for Safer Generative AI
summary: Many approaches to AI safety rely on inspecting model outputs or activations, yet certain risks are inherently undetectable by inspection alone. We propose a complementary, architecture-agnostic approach that enhances safety through the aggregation of multiple generative models, with the aggregated model inheriting its safety from the safest subset of a given size among them. Specifically, we present a consensus sampling algorithm that, given $k$ models and a prompt, achieves risk competitive with the average risk of the safest $s$ of the $k$ models, where $s$ is a chosen parameter, while abstaining when there is insufficient agreement between them. The approach leverages the models' ability to compute output probabilities, and we bound the probability of abstention when sufficiently many models are safe and exhibit adequate agreement. The algorithm is inspired by the provable copyright protection algorithm of Vyas et al. (2023). It requires some overlap among safe models, offers no protection when all models are unsafe, and may accumulate risk over repeated use. Nonetheless, our results provide a new, model-agnostic approach for AI safety by amplifying safety guarantees from an unknown subset of models within a collection to that of a single reliable model.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种架构无关的共识采样算法，通过聚合多个生成模型来增强AI安全性。该算法旨在使其风险与最安全子集中的模型风险相当，并在模型间协议不足时选择拒绝输出。
AI.motivation: 许多现有的AI安全方法依赖于检查模型输出或激活，但某些风险本质上无法通过单独检查来检测。因此，需要一种互补的、与架构无关的方法来增强安全性。
AI.method: 研究者提出了一种共识采样算法，该算法聚合了k个生成模型。它利用模型计算输出概率的能力，并当模型间协议不足时拒绝输出。该方法受到Vyas et al. (2023) 的可证明版权保护算法的启发。
AI.result: 该算法实现了与k个模型中最安全的s个模型的平均风险相当的风险水平。当足够多的模型是安全的并且表现出足够的协议时，研究者对拒绝输出的概率进行了界定。该方法将一个模型集合中未知安全子集的安全性保证提升至单个可靠模型的水平。
AI.conclusion: 尽管存在一些限制（例如需要安全模型之间存在重叠、所有模型都不安全时无法提供保护、重复使用可能累积风险），但本文的结果为AI安全提供了一种新的、模型无关的方法，通过聚合模型来放大安全保障。

title: HalluClean: A Unified Framework to Combat Hallucinations in LLMs
summary: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved impressive performance across a wide range of natural language processing tasks, yet they often produce hallucinated content that undermines factual reliability. To address this challenge, we introduce HalluClean, a lightweight and task-agnostic framework for detecting and correcting hallucinations in LLM-generated text. HalluClean adopts a reasoning-enhanced paradigm, explicitly decomposing the process into planning, execution, and revision stages to identify and refine unsupported claims. It employs minimal task-routing prompts to enable zero-shot generalization across diverse domains, without relying on external knowledge sources or supervised detectors. We conduct extensive evaluations on five representative tasks-question answering, dialogue, summarization, math word problems, and contradiction detection. Experimental results show that HalluClean significantly improves factual consistency and outperforms competitive baselines, demonstrating its potential to enhance the trustworthiness of LLM outputs in real-world applications.

title: SPEED-Q: Staged Processing with Enhanced Distillation towards Efficient Low-bit On-device VLM Quantization
summary: Deploying Vision-Language Models (VLMs) on edge devices (e.g., smartphones and robots) is crucial for enabling low-latency and privacy-preserving intelligent applications. Given the resource constraints of these devices, quantization offers a promising solution by improving memory efficiency and reducing bandwidth requirements, thereby facilitating the deployment of VLMs. However, existing research has rarely explored aggressive quantization on VLMs, particularly for the models ranging from 1B to 2B parameters, which are more suitable for resource-constrained edge devices. In this paper, we propose SPEED-Q, a novel Staged Processing with Enhanced Distillation framework for VLM low-bit weight-only quantization that systematically addresses the following two critical obstacles: (1) significant discrepancies in quantization sensitivity between vision (ViT) and language (LLM) components in VLMs; (2) training instability arising from the reduced numerical precision inherent in low-bit quantization. In SPEED-Q, a staged sensitivity adaptive mechanism is introduced to effectively harmonize performance across different modalities. We further propose a distillation-enhanced quantization strategy to stabilize the training process and reduce data dependence. Together, SPEED-Q enables accurate, stable, and data-efficient quantization of complex VLMs. SPEED-Q is the first framework tailored for quantizing entire small-scale billion-parameter VLMs to low bits. Extensive experiments across multiple benchmarks demonstrate that SPEED-Q achieves up to 6x higher accuracy than existing quantization methods under 2-bit settings and consistently outperforms prior on-device VLMs under both 2-bit and 4-bit settings. Our code and models are available at https://github.com/antgroup/SPEED-Q.

AI.tldr: SPEED-Q是一种针对边缘设备上小规模视觉-语言模型（VLM）的低比特量化框架，通过分阶段敏感性自适应和蒸馏增强策略，解决了视觉和语言组件的量化敏感性差异以及低比特量化带来的训练不稳定性问题，实现了高精度、稳定和数据高效的量化。
AI.motivation: 在边缘设备上部署VLM对于实现低延迟和隐私保护的智能应用至关重要。由于这些设备的资源限制，量化是一种有前景的解决方案，可以提高内存效率并减少带宽需求。然而，现有研究很少探索对VLM进行激进量化，特别是针对参数量在1B到2B之间、更适合资源受限边缘设备的小规模模型。
AI.method: 本文提出了SPEED-Q框架，这是一种新颖的“分阶段处理与增强蒸馏”（Staged Processing with Enhanced Distillation）方法，用于VLM的低比特仅权重（weight-only）量化。它主要解决两个关键障碍：(1) VLM中视觉（ViT）和语言（LLM）组件之间显著的量化敏感性差异；(2) 低比特量化固有的数值精度降低导致的训练不稳定性。SPEED-Q引入了分阶段敏感性自适应机制来协调不同模态的性能，并提出了蒸馏增强量化策略来稳定训练过程并减少数据依赖性。
AI.result: SPEED-Q是首个专门为将整个小规模十亿参数VLM量化到低比特而设计的框架。在多项基准测试中，SPEED-Q在2比特设置下比现有量化方法实现了高达6倍的准确度提升，并在2比特和4比特设置下始终优于先前的设备端VLM。
AI.conclusion: SPEED-Q框架能够对复杂的VLM进行准确、稳定和数据高效的低比特量化，解决了部署VLM到边缘设备的关键挑战，使其更适用于资源受限的环境。

title: IFG: Internet-Scale Guidance for Functional Grasping Generation
summary: Large Vision Models trained on internet-scale data have demonstrated strong capabilities in segmenting and semantically understanding object parts, even in cluttered, crowded scenes. However, while these models can direct a robot toward the general region of an object, they lack the geometric understanding required to precisely control dexterous robotic hands for 3D grasping. To overcome this, our key insight is to leverage simulation with a force-closure grasping generation pipeline that understands local geometries of the hand and object in the scene. Because this pipeline is slow and requires ground-truth observations, the resulting data is distilled into a diffusion model that operates in real-time on camera point clouds. By combining the global semantic understanding of internet-scale models with the geometric precision of a simulation-based locally-aware force-closure, \our achieves high-performance semantic grasping without any manually collected training data. For visualizations of this please visit our website at https://ifgrasping.github.io/

AI.tldr: 该研究结合大规模视觉模型的全局语义理解与基于模拟的局部几何力闭合抓取，实现了无需手动训练数据的高性能语义抓取。
AI.motivation: 大规模视觉模型虽能理解物体语义并定位大致区域，但缺乏精确的几何理解，无法控制灵巧机器人手进行3D抓取。
AI.method: 核心思想是利用模拟器中的力闭合抓取生成管道来理解手和物体的局部几何。由于此管道速度慢且需要真值观测，其生成的数据被提炼到一个扩散模型中，该模型能实时处理相机点云。最终，将互联网规模模型的全局语义理解与基于模拟的局部感知力闭合的几何精度相结合。
AI.result: 通过这种方法，实现了高性能的语义抓取，并且整个过程无需任何手动收集的训练数据。
AI.conclusion: 结合互联网规模模型的全局语义理解和基于模拟的局部感知力闭合的几何精度，可以实现高精度语义抓取，同时避免了手动数据收集的需求。

title: Context-Aware Dynamic Chunking for Streaming Tibetan Speech Recognition
summary: In this work, we propose a streaming speech recognition framework for Amdo Tibetan, built upon a hybrid CTC/Atten-tion architecture with a context-aware dynamic chunking mechanism. The proposed strategy adaptively adjusts chunk widths based on encoding states, enabling flexible receptive fields, cross-chunk information exchange, and robust adaptation to varying speaking rates, thereby alleviating the context truncation problem of fixed-chunk methods. To further capture the linguistic characteristics of Tibetan, we construct a lexicon grounded in its orthographic principles, providing linguistically motivated modeling units. During decoding, an external language model is integrated to enhance semantic consistency and improve recognition of long sentences. Experimental results show that the proposed framework achieves a word error rate (WER) of 6.23% on the test set, yielding a 48.15% relative improvement over the fixed-chunk baseline, while significantly reducing recognition latency and maintaining performance close to global decoding.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于混合CTC/Attention架构的安多藏语流式语音识别框架，通过上下文感知的动态分块机制和语言学驱动的词典构建，显著提升了识别性能并降低了延迟。
AI.motivation: 固定分块方法在流式语音识别中存在上下文截断问题，难以适应变化的语速，且安多藏语作为一种低资源语言，需要专门的语音识别解决方案来捕捉其语言特性。
AI.method: 该研究采用混合CTC/Attention架构，并引入上下文感知的动态分块机制，根据编码状态自适应调整块宽度，实现灵活的感受野和跨块信息交换。同时，构建了基于藏语正字法原则的词典作为建模单元，并在解码时整合外部语言模型以增强语义一致性。
AI.result: 所提出的框架在测试集上取得了6.23%的词错误率（WER），相对于固定分块基线有48.15%的相对改进，显著降低了识别延迟，并保持了接近全局解码的性能。
AI.conclusion: 该框架为安多藏语流式语音识别提供了一个高效且鲁棒的解决方案，动态分块机制有效解决了上下文截断问题，而语言学驱动的建模单元和外部语言模型进一步提升了识别准确性。

title: MM-CRITIC: A Holistic Evaluation of Large Multimodal Models as Multimodal Critique
summary: The ability of critique is vital for models to self-improve and serve as reliable AI assistants. While extensively studied in language-only settings, multimodal critique of Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) remains underexplored despite their growing capabilities in tasks like captioning and visual reasoning. In this work, we introduce MM-CRITIC, a holistic benchmark for evaluating the critique ability of LMMs across multiple dimensions: basic, correction, and comparison. Covering 8 main task types and over 500 tasks, MM-CRITIC collects responses from various LMMs with different model sizes and is composed of 4471 samples. To enhance the evaluation reliability, we integrate expert-informed ground answers into scoring rubrics that guide GPT-4o in annotating responses and generating reference critiques, which serve as anchors for trustworthy judgments. Extensive experiments validate the effectiveness of MM-CRITIC and provide a comprehensive assessment of leading LMMs' critique capabilities under multiple dimensions. Further analysis reveals some key insights, including the correlation between response quality and critique, and varying critique difficulty across evaluation dimensions. Our code is available at https://github.com/MichealZeng0420/MM-Critic.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了MM-CRITIC，一个用于评估大型多模态模型（LMMs）多模态批判能力的综合基准，涵盖基本、纠正和比较等多个维度，并利用专家指导的GPT-4o进行评估。
AI.motivation: 批判能力对于模型自我改进和作为可靠AI助手至关重要。尽管在纯语言环境中得到了广泛研究，但鉴于大型多模态模型（LMMs）在图像描述和视觉推理等任务中能力的增长，对它们的多模态批判能力的研究仍然不足。
AI.method: 引入MM-CRITIC，一个涵盖8种主要任务类型、超过500个任务、包含4471个样本的全面基准。该基准收集了不同尺寸LMMs的响应，并整合了专家指导的参考答案到评分标准中，以指导GPT-4o标注响应并生成参考批判，从而确保评估的可靠性。
AI.result: 广泛的实验验证了MM-CRITIC的有效性，并对领先LMMs在多个维度下的批判能力进行了全面评估。进一步分析揭示了一些关键见解，包括响应质量与批判之间的相关性，以及不同评估维度下批判难度差异。
AI.conclusion: MM-CRITIC为评估LMMs的多模态批判能力提供了一个有效且全面的工具，并揭示了当前LMMs在该领域表现的关键洞察，为未来的模型改进指明了方向。

title: From Structure to Detail: Hierarchical Distillation for Efficient Diffusion Model
summary: The inference latency of diffusion models remains a critical barrier to their real-time application. While trajectory-based and distribution-based step distillation methods offer solutions, they present a fundamental trade-off. Trajectory-based methods preserve global structure but act as a "lossy compressor", sacrificing high-frequency details. Conversely, distribution-based methods can achieve higher fidelity but often suffer from mode collapse and unstable training. This paper recasts them from independent paradigms into synergistic components within our novel Hierarchical Distillation (HD) framework. We leverage trajectory distillation not as a final generator, but to establish a structural ``sketch", providing a near-optimal initialization for the subsequent distribution-based refinement stage. This strategy yields an ideal initial distribution that enhances the ceiling of overall performance. To further improve quality, we introduce and refine the adversarial training process. We find standard discriminator structures are ineffective at refining an already high-quality generator. To overcome this, we introduce the Adaptive Weighted Discriminator (AWD), tailored for the HD pipeline. By dynamically allocating token weights, AWD focuses on local imperfections, enabling efficient detail refinement. Our approach demonstrates state-of-the-art performance across diverse tasks. On ImageNet $256\times256$, our single-step model achieves an FID of 2.26, rivaling its 250-step teacher. It also achieves promising results on the high-resolution text-to-image MJHQ benchmark, proving its generalizability. Our method establishes a robust new paradigm for high-fidelity, single-step diffusion models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出分层蒸馏（HD）框架，将轨迹蒸馏和分布蒸馏结合，以解决扩散模型推理延迟问题，实现高保真单步生成，并在多项任务上达到SOTA性能。
AI.motivation: 扩散模型的推理延迟是其实时应用的关键障碍。现有蒸馏方法存在局限：基于轨迹的方法牺牲高频细节，而基于分布的方法则面临模式崩溃和训练不稳定的问题。
AI.method: 本文提出分层蒸馏（HD）框架，将轨迹蒸馏作为结构“草图”提供近乎最优的初始化，随后进行基于分布的细化阶段。为进一步提升质量，引入并改进对抗训练过程，特别设计了自适应加权判别器（AWD），通过动态分配token权重来关注局部缺陷，有效细化高品质生成器。
AI.result: 该方法在ImageNet $256	imes256$上，单步模型实现了2.26的FID，与250步教师模型相当。在高分辨率文本到图像MJHQ基准测试中也取得了有前景的结果，证明了其泛化能力。整体表现达到最先进水平。
AI.conclusion: 该方法为高保真、单步扩散模型建立了一个鲁棒的新范式。

title: HOTFLoc++: End-to-End Hierarchical LiDAR Place Recognition, Re-Ranking, and 6-DoF Metric Localisation in Forests
summary: This article presents HOTFLoc++, an end-to-end framework for LiDAR place recognition, re-ranking, and 6-DoF metric localisation in forests. Leveraging an octree-based transformer, our approach extracts hierarchical local descriptors at multiple granularities to increase robustness to clutter, self-similarity, and viewpoint changes in challenging scenarios, including ground-to-ground and ground-to-aerial in forest and urban environments. We propose a learnable multi-scale geometric verification module to reduce re-ranking failures in the presence of degraded single-scale correspondences. Our coarse-to-fine registration approach achieves comparable or lower localisation errors to baselines, with runtime improvements of two orders of magnitude over RANSAC for dense point clouds. Experimental results on public datasets show the superiority of our approach compared to state-of-the-art methods, achieving an average Recall@1 of 90.7% on CS-Wild-Places: an improvement of 29.6 percentage points over baselines, while maintaining high performance on single-source benchmarks with an average Recall@1 of 91.7% and 96.0% on Wild-Places and MulRan, respectively. Our method achieves under 2 m and 5 degrees error for 97.2% of 6-DoF registration attempts, with our multi-scale re-ranking module reducing localisation errors by ~2$\times$ on average. The code will be available upon acceptance.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了HOTFLoc++，一个用于森林环境中激光雷达地点识别、重排序和6自由度定位的端到端框架，通过八叉树Transformer和多尺度几何验证，显著提升了在复杂场景下的鲁棒性和效率。
AI.motivation: 在森林和城市等复杂环境中，激光雷达地点识别面临杂波、自相似性和视角变化等挑战，需要提高对这些情况的鲁棒性，并减少重排序失败和提高定位精度。
AI.method: 该方法提出了HOTFLoc++框架，利用基于八叉树的Transformer提取多粒度的分层局部描述符；引入可学习的多尺度几何验证模块以减少重排序失败；并采用粗到精的配准方法实现定位。
AI.result: HOTFLoc++在公共数据集上表现优越，在CS-Wild-Places上平均Recall@1达到90.7%（提升29.6个百分点），在Wild-Places和MulRan上分别达到91.7%和96.0%。97.2%的6自由度配准尝试误差在2米和5度以内，多尺度重排序模块平均将定位误差降低约2倍。配准运行时比RANSAC快两个数量级。
AI.conclusion: HOTFLoc++通过其创新的八叉树Transformer和多尺度几何验证，显著提高了在森林等挑战性环境中激光雷达地点识别和6自由度定位的准确性和效率，超越了现有最先进的方法。

title: Fundamentals of Physical AI
comment: This paper is already published in Journal of Intelligent System of Systems Lifecycle Management
summary: This work will elaborate the fundamental principles of physical artificial intelligence (Physical AI) from a scientific and systemic perspective. The aim is to create a theoretical foundation that describes the physical embodiment, sensory perception, ability to act, learning processes, and context sensitivity of intelligent systems within a coherent framework. While classical AI approaches rely on symbolic processing and data driven models, Physical AI understands intelligence as an emergent phenomenon of real interaction between body, environment, and experience. The six fundamentals presented here are embodiment, sensory perception, motor action, learning, autonomy, and context sensitivity, and form the conceptual basis for designing and evaluating physically intelligent systems. Theoretically, it is shown that these six principles do not represent loose functional modules but rather act as a closed control loop in which energy, information, control, and context are in constant interaction. This circular interaction enables a system to generate meaning not from databases, but from physical experience, a paradigm shift that understands intelligence as an physical embodied process. Physical AI understands learning not as parameter adjustment, but as a change in the structural coupling between agents and the environment. To illustrate this, the theoretical model is explained using a practical scenario: An adaptive assistant robot supports patients in a rehabilitation clinic. This example illustrates that physical intelligence does not arise from abstract calculation, but from immediate, embodied experience. It shows how the six fundamentals interact in a real system: embodiment as a prerequisite, perception as input, movement as expression, learning as adaptation, autonomy as regulation, and context as orientation.

AI.tldr: 本文从科学和系统角度阐述了物理人工智能（Physical AI）的基本原理，提出了六个核心要素：具身性、感知、运动、学习、自主性和语境敏感性，并将其视为一个闭环控制系统，强调智能是身体、环境和经验之间真实互动涌现的具身过程。
AI.motivation: 传统AI依赖符号处理和数据驱动模型，而Physical AI旨在建立一个连贯的理论框架，将智能理解为身体、环境和经验之间真实互动的涌现现象，从而克服传统AI的局限性，并从物理具身过程的角度重新定义智能和学习。
AI.method: 本文通过阐述物理AI的六个基本原理（具身性、感知、运动、学习、自主性、语境敏感性），构建了一个理论基础。理论上，将这六个原理视为一个能量、信息、控制和语境持续交互的闭环控制系统。为说明其概念，文章还使用了一个自适应康复助理机器人的实际场景进行解释。
AI.result: 研究提出了物理AI的六个核心要素，并证明它们并非独立的模块，而是一个紧密交互的闭环控制系统。该系统使得智能体能够从物理经验而非数据库中生成意义。学习被重新定义为智能体与环境之间结构耦合的变化。通过康复机器人案例，展示了具身智能如何从即时、具身的经验中产生，而非抽象计算。
AI.conclusion: 物理AI将智能理解为一个物理具身的过程，而非抽象计算或参数调整。它通过强调具身性、感知、运动、学习、自主性和语境敏感性在闭环交互中的作用，为设计和评估具身智能系统提供了概念基础，标志着智能范式从数据驱动向物理经验驱动的转变。

title: Boosting Adversarial Transferability via Ensemble Non-Attention
summary: Ensemble attacks integrate the outputs of surrogate models with diverse architectures, which can be combined with various gradient-based attacks to improve adversarial transferability. However, previous work shows unsatisfactory attack performance when transferring across heterogeneous model architectures. The main reason is that the gradient update directions of heterogeneous surrogate models differ widely, making it hard to reduce the gradient variance of ensemble models while making the best of individual model. To tackle this challenge, we design a novel ensemble attack, NAMEA, which for the first time integrates the gradients from the non-attention areas of ensemble models into the iterative gradient optimization process. Our design is inspired by the observation that the attention areas of heterogeneous models vary sharply, thus the non-attention areas of ViTs are likely to be the focus of CNNs and vice versa. Therefore, we merge the gradients respectively from the attention and non-attention areas of ensemble models so as to fuse the transfer information of CNNs and ViTs. Specifically, we pioneer a new way of decoupling the gradients of non-attention areas from those of attention areas, while merging gradients by meta-learning. Empirical evaluations on ImageNet dataset indicate that NAMEA outperforms AdaEA and SMER, the state-of-the-art ensemble attacks by an average of 15.0% and 9.6%, respectively. This work is the first attempt to explore the power of ensemble non-attention in boosting cross-architecture transferability, providing new insights into launching ensemble attacks.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为NAMEA的新型集成攻击方法，首次将集成模型中非注意力区域的梯度整合到迭代梯度优化过程中，显著提高了跨异构模型架构（如CNN和ViT）的对抗性样本可迁移性。
AI.motivation: 现有的集成攻击在跨异构模型架构（如CNN和ViT）迁移时性能不佳，主要原因是异构替代模型的梯度更新方向差异大，难以在降低梯度方差的同时充分利用个体模型的优势。
AI.method: NAMEA方法受到异构模型注意力区域差异大的启发，认为一个模型的非注意力区域可能是另一个模型的关注点。它首次将集成模型中非注意力区域的梯度整合到迭代梯度优化过程中，并通过元学习的方式解耦并融合来自注意力区域和非注意力区域的梯度，以融合CNN和ViT的迁移信息。
AI.result: 在ImageNet数据集上的实证评估表明，NAMEA的性能优于最先进的集成攻击方法AdaEA和SMER，平均分别提高了15.0%和9.6%。
AI.conclusion: 这项工作首次探索了集成非注意力在提升跨架构可迁移性方面的潜力，为发起集成攻击提供了新的见解。

title: Neural B-frame Video Compression with Bi-directional Reference Harmonization
summary: Neural video compression (NVC) has made significant progress in recent years, while neural B-frame video compression (NBVC) remains underexplored compared to P-frame compression. NBVC can adopt bi-directional reference frames for better compression performance. However, NBVC's hierarchical coding may complicate continuous temporal prediction, especially at some hierarchical levels with a large frame span, which could cause the contribution of the two reference frames to be unbalanced. To optimize reference information utilization, we propose a novel NBVC method, termed Bi-directional Reference Harmonization Video Compression (BRHVC), with the proposed Bi-directional Motion Converge (BMC) and Bi-directional Contextual Fusion (BCF). BMC converges multiple optical flows in motion compression, leading to more accurate motion compensation on a larger scale. Then BCF explicitly models the weights of reference contexts under the guidance of motion compensation accuracy. With more efficient motions and contexts, BRHVC can effectively harmonize bi-directional references. Experimental results indicate that our BRHVC outperforms previous state-of-the-art NVC methods, even surpassing the traditional coding, VTM-RA (under random access configuration), on the HEVC datasets. The source code is released at https://github.com/kwai/NVC.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为BRHVC的新型神经B帧视频压缩(NBVC)方法，通过双向运动融合(BMC)和双向上下文融合(BCF)来优化双向参考信息的利用，从而实现更优的压缩性能。
AI.motivation: 神经B帧视频压缩(NBVC)相较于P帧压缩仍未得到充分探索。NBVC虽然能利用双向参考帧，但其分层编码可能导致连续时间预测复杂化，尤其是在大帧跨度层级，可能造成两个参考帧的贡献不平衡，需要优化参考信息利用。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种名为双向参考协调视频压缩(BRHVC)的新型NBVC方法。该方法包含：1. 双向运动融合(BMC)，用于在运动压缩中融合多个光流，实现更大尺度上更准确的运动补偿。2. 双向上下文融合(BCF)，在运动补偿精度的指导下，明确建模参考上下文的权重。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，BRHVC超越了现有最先进的NVC方法，甚至在HEVC数据集上优于传统编码VTM-RA（随机访问配置下）。
AI.conclusion: BRHVC通过更高效的运动和上下文处理，有效协调了双向参考帧，显著提升了神经视频压缩的性能，达到了领先水平。

title: A Neurosymbolic Approach to Natural Language Formalization and Verification
summary: Large Language Models perform well at natural language interpretation and reasoning, but their inherent stochasticity limits their adoption in regulated industries like finance and healthcare that operate under strict policies. To address this limitation, we present a two-stage neurosymbolic framework that (1) uses LLMs with optional human guidance to formalize natural language policies, allowing fine-grained control of the formalization process, and (2) uses inference-time autoformalization to validate logical correctness of natural language statements against those policies. When correctness is paramount, we perform multiple redundant formalization steps at inference time, cross checking the formalizations for semantic equivalence. Our benchmarks demonstrate that our approach exceeds 99% soundness, indicating a near-zero false positive rate in identifying logical validity. Our approach produces auditable logical artifacts that substantiate the verification outcomes and can be used to improve the original text.
